poem:
**Last Witness**

The clock struck twice:  
time and life. On cold steel,
his innocence unspoken,  
echoed through the glass.  
Yet the ink dried,  
thirteen years deep.  
No confession too late,  
no justice too blind.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Carolina executes first man in 13 years despite new evidence of innocence South Carolina executed a man on death row on Friday, days after the key witness for the prosecution came forward to say he lied at trial and the state was putting to death an innocent man. Khalil Divine Black Sun Allah, 46, was killed by lethal injection, pronounced dead at 6.55pm, according to the Associated Press, which was one of several media". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
